page.title: 06FARMING 2
page.content: CONSERVATION AND HEDGING. At present fields being converted from 15 acres to 25 acres in line with modern ideas of ratio of cattle to acreage.Hedging,rather than fencing,being used.Upkeep of both nearly equal,hedging preferable for conservation.New hedging along northern boundary and on road through farm (to improve scenic value,hide ugly electricity pylons which cross farm).Beech growing much better than hawthorn at present.If this experiment is successful costwise,hedge will be planted on western boundary too. Mr.Nelson,the farmer,has found that hedging has the advantage over trees in that it does not shade crops,nor does it encourage flies,which are a problem as they attack the teats of dairy cows.Infected cows can die within three days.
